title: Tagalog language
summary: Tagalog (/təˈɡɑːlɒɡ/, tə-GAH-log;[4] locally [tɐˈɡaːloɡ]; Baybayin: ᜆᜄᜎᜓᜄ᜔) is an Austronesian language spoken as a first language by the ethnic Tagalog people, who make up a quarter of the population of the Philippines, and as a second language by the majority.[5][6] Its standardized form, officially named Filipino, is the national language of the Philippines, and is one of two official languages, alongside English.
